title: AMERICAN HORROR STORY: True Crimes That Inspired Coven
author: GameSpot Universe
comment: I want to look as beautiful as Angels Bassett when I get older.

It's a shame there was ever a system that literally allowed sadistic freaks like LaLaurie to just purchase their own torture victims. RIP to all the poor innocent enslaved people throughout history and still today. What a tragedy smh.
I need to re-watch American horror stories. Angela Bassett  is stunning!
Kathy Bates was incredible... she won the emmy! She was frightening as Laulaurie
description:
Here are the true stories that inspired major plot points in AHS Coven. Season 3 references Madame Delphine LaLaurie, Marie Laveau, and the Axeman of New Orleans.

Much like it’s predecessors, American Horror Story: Coven drew on a bunch of inspiration from history, and a handful of Coven's most iconic characters are based on real-life figures. In this video, Greg breaks down AHS Season 3's true crime inspirations: Madame Delphine LaLaurie, the voodoo queen Marie Laveau, and the jazz-loving Axeman of New Orleans.

Subscribe to GameSpot Universe!
